title: Hamill Canyon
opening: Jehanna, home of dancing white sands. This largely barren desert nation is infamous for its mercenary forces. In accordance with her husband’s dying wish, the beautiful Ismaire rules Jehanna. The Queen of the White Dunes governs Jehanna with Grace and Honor. When he was young, her son left Jehanna. His whereabouts remain unknown. After passing through Caer Pelyn, Eirika arrives in Jehanna. There, she finds the nation embroiled in combat with Grado’s forces.

intro.speaker: Cormag
intro.line: My brother is...dead? That can’t be! That’s impossible!

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: There’s no mistake. Look for yourself. I’ve brought his corpse with me. That’s him right over there, isn’t it?

intro.speaker: Cormag
intro.line: No... Brother...

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: Not a pretty sight, eh? You’ll be hard pressed to ready that for a proper burial. But listen, Cormag. There’s no reason for you to grieve. After all, who is better than you to replace your brother in His Majesty’s service? Picture it: General Cormag, the new and improved Sunstone, eh?

intro.speaker: Cormag
intro.line: Who did this... Who is responsible? Who!?

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: Glen’s last orders were to find and subdue Eirika. ‘Tis a pity I was delayed. I arrived to witness the final blow myself. I watched Eirika run her blade right through his chest and then flee.

intro.speaker: Cormag
intro.line: Eirika?! Where is she now?

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: Hm? What would you do if I told you? Without orders from His Majesty...

intro.speaker: Cormag
intro.line: ANSWER ME!

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: ...In the eastern mountains of Carcino. The forests are thick in that region. It won’t be easy finding her, but...

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: Gone already? I’ve sent a gift your way, Eirika, but I trust you can handle it. You’re my girl after all. I need you to be strong for me... Heh heh... ha ha ha ha ha!

intro.speaker: Messenger
intro.line: Messenger! Messenger! I bring word from Frelia!

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Go on. What news do you bring?

intro.speaker: Messenger
intro.line: Prince Innes! You’re alive and well! When the reinforcements rode into Carcino, you were nowhere to be seen... We thought perhaps the enemy forces had reached you and... It’s good to see you well, milord.

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: I’m sorry to have troubled you. But remember, the duty I bear is a harsh master. It will not let me die easily.

intro.speaker: Messenger
intro.line: Of course. Prince Innes...

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Yes, what word do you bring of Frelia? Speak!

intro.speaker: Messenger
intro.line: Yes, Your Highness! Frelia has invaded Carcino and engaged the traitor Pablo’s mercenary army. With aid from the elder Klimt, we are crushing the foe where we find them. Pablo’s faction is retreating ever southward, toward Jehanna...

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Towards Jehanna? They must be planning to join with the Grado forces there.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Pardon me, but I must know... Do you have word of my brother?

intro.speaker: Messenger
intro.line: Yes. Prince Ephraim has forced them surrender of Grado’s fortress at Rigwald. He is now marching onward toward the imperial capital.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Toward the capital...

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: That fool... Emperor Vigarde himself and his imperial guard are in the capital. It’s too strong a force... Even for Ephraim.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: No... I believe in my brother. I know he fights still. The bracelet tells me so.

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: Ah, Eirika. Is it time to go already?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: L’Arachel. We’re going to break through the Grado lines and join the army of Jehanna. You should keep to the rear where it’s safe...

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: No, I will stay with you. Confronting evil boldly is the sworn duty of any ally of justice. And it may be that Grado’s goal is the Stone of Jehanna... I cannot stand by and let it be destroyed.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: L’Arachel? Where did you come by such information?

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: Hm? That...uh, well...the...wind whispered to me in the night.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: The wind? Whispered to you?

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: Yes, that’s right. ...And according to that gentle breeze, there are knights riding this way from Rausten even as we speak. If we can but hold out until they arrive, the battle will surely be ours. Come, Eirika. Let us be on our way.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: W-wait a moment. L’Arachel? Who are you?

intro.speaker: Caellach
intro.line: They should be arriving anytime now. Are you ready, Aias?

intro.speaker: Aias
intro.line: Mm. Everything’s in place. This Princess Eirika supposedly defeated General Glen. I wonder... If it’s true, then she’s a foe to be reckoned with, and no doubt. Still, there’s no reason to worry. I can best her. I know it.

intro.speaker: Caellach
intro.line: You’ll take her, I’ve no fear. We fought as mercenaries together, and I know what you’re capable of. I could search the continent over and not find a man to match your skills.

intro.speaker: Aias
intro.line: I’m honored to hear you say that. But I’ve no interest in the titles and trapping of Grado’s Imperial Army.

intro.speaker: Caellach
intro.line: Don’t say that. You’re glad you came with me, right? You know we were both sick to death of living like desert rats. I’m going to be king one day. This war is just the beginning.

intro.speaker: Aias
intro.line: Ah... It starts again.

intro.speaker: Caellach
intro.line: Word has it that the Knights of Rausten are riding from the north. They’re mine. I can trust this mess to your capable hands, can’t I, Aias?

intro.speaker: Aias
intro.line: You remember what they called me when we were mercenaries, don’t you? I was never once wounded on the field of battle. Not once... My skill is not garnish and loud like yours, but I’ve never known defeat.

intro.speaker: Caellach
intro.line: Yes, that is true. I’m depending on you, Aias.

intro.speaker: Aias
intro.line: ..... All units prepare for battle.

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Princess Eirika. The enemy is arrayed before us. We’ve word that Pablo’s mercenary army is closing in from the rear. You must be cautious.

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: All we have to do is hold them off until the Knights of Rausten arrive. If we can do that, victory is as good as ours. Let’s get started, shall we, Eirika?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Indeed!

boss.speaker: Pablo
boss.line: Grrr... I’ve got more money then you’ve ever seen. What say you? Join me, and take a seat of power at my side.

boss.speaker: Pablo
boss.line: Argh... It can’t be...I... You can’t have my gold... It’s all...mine...

recruit-talk.speaker: Cormag
recruit-talk.line: You don’t know me, but you know my brother well enough. I’m Cormag. I’m the brother of Glen, general of the Grado army, whom you killed?

recruit-talk.speaker: Cormag
recruit-talk.line: This is no longer war, and this is not a battlefield. This is a duel, and I fight to avenge my brother. He died in combat, and I’ll not foul his name by murdering you unarmed. But I will have vengeance.

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: Hold! What is the meaning of this? Glen... Are you telling me General Glen is dead?

recruit-talk.speaker: Cormag
recruit-talk.line: Do not play me for a fool! You will not... Your lies do nothing but stain your honor. Nothing more.

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: You’ve got it wrong! You’re making a mistake. Your brother and I never fought. He lowered his lance and left the battlefield to confront your emperor.

recruit-talk.speaker: Cormag
recruit-talk.line: ...My brother? You lie! Where is your proof?

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: I’ve no proof. But... Here are the words he spoke to me. He told me he believed I possessed a gentle heart when we met before. He said I had not lost that quality...

recruit-talk.speaker: Cormag
recruit-talk.line: ..... I see... Those are indeed my brother’s words. But then who? Who benefits from– ...Ah! ...Valter!

recruit-talk.speaker: Cormag
recruit-talk.line: ...Princess Eirika of Renais. I would be your ally.

recruit-talk.speaker: Cormag
recruit-talk.line: I don’t care why you’re fighting. I’ve no interest in your goals. I want nothing but revenge, and I will have it. If I can kill Valter with these two hands, what care I if Grado brands me a traitor?

battle.speaker: Aias
battle.line: Rausten knights?! That means Caellach’s– Curses... All troops! Retreat at once!

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Forward the lances! Show them the might of Rausten!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: The Knights of Rausten! Just as L’Arachel said... Reinforcements have arrived in Jehanna!

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: What I’d like to know is what took them so long! However, it seems that all has worked out in the end.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Princess! Knights of Rausten, 2nd battalion, reporting for duty!

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Well done. You may lift your eyes.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Princess? L’Arachel, you’re a–

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: What? Oh, you mean... Don’t be silly. This is nothing. Please don’t concern yourself.

end.speaker: Dozla
end.line: I do believe, milady, that your disguise has been penetrated.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Oh... I suppose there’s naught to be done about it now. Very well, Eirika. You’ve found me out! The beauteous wanderer who’s been your boon companion is none other then... the jewel of the theocracy of Rausten, Princess L’Arachel herself! I was acting under divine order to strike down evil in this land.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: ..... Is that so? But why did you...

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: The truth is... The princess was enflamed by the words of the court troubadour, Saaga... She forced us to allow her to journey forth anonymously on a quest for justice.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: I-I see...

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Princess. This is from King Mansel.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: What’s this? War funds? Oh, what a grand uncle. He’s just so thoughtful. Princess Eirika of Renais. Rausten will not yield to Grado. Together, let us defeat the empire in the name of righteousness!

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Princess Eirika. Princes Innes. I’ve received word from the front. The palace of Jehanna was attacked by Grado forces and has surrendered.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: What? How did that...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: And the queen? Is she safe?

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: That remains unknown.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: She may yet live. We must hurry.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: The palace has already been occupied by imperial troops. The Grado army is being led by Lyon, the imperial prince.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Lyon?!

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: What it is, Eirika?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: It’s nothing... ...Lyon...

end.speaker: Caellach
end.line: Hey, Aias.

end.speaker: Aias
end.line: Caellach...

end.speaker: Caellach
end.line: That was something awful. I never expected to see you get beaten so roundly.

end.speaker: Aias
end.line: Yes. It was a complete failure. The Rausten knights arrived far more quickly then I’d anticipated. But it doesn’t matter, does it? Whether I won or lost? You were planning on abandoning me from the start, weren’t you?

end.speaker: Caellach
end.line: ...Yeah, sorry. I’m not going to let things end for me here. I want to rise... To climb higher and higher. I will not be chained to my past. I will not be chained to you. I truly apologize, but you die here. Good-bye, my friend.
